member.summary: Gets an input providing read access to the raw PCM audio data between given sub-clip begin and end times

remarks.para: Sub-clip times must be in the interval [0;this.getAudioDuration()].

The sub-clip is relative to clip begin of the WavClip, that if this.getClipBegin() returns 00:00:10, this.getClipEnd() returns 00:00:50, x and y is 00:00:05 and 00:00:30 respectively, then this.getAudioData(x, y) will get the audio in the underlying wave audio between 00:00:15 and 00:00:40

member.name: T:urakawa.property.channel.ChannelFactory
member.summary: The actual implementation to be implemented by the implementation team ;) All method bodies must be completed for realizing the required business logic. - This is the DEFAULT implementation for the API/Toolkit: end-users should feel free to use this class as such, or they can sub-class it in order to specialize the instance creation process. - In addition, an end-user has the possibility to implement the singleton factory pattern, so that only one instance of the factory is used throughout the application life (by adding a method like "static Factory getFactory()").

member.name: M:urakawa.undo.UndoRedoManager.startTransaction
member.summary: Starts a transaction: marks the current level in the history as the point where the transaction begins. Any following call to will push the a into the history and execute it normally. After the call, must return true. Transactions can be nested, so programmers must make sure to start and end/cancel transactions in pairs (e.g. a call to for each ). A transaction can be canceled (rollback), and all s un-executed by calling .

member.name: M:urakawa.undo.UndoRedoManager.endTransaction
member.summary: Ends the active transaction: Wraps any s executed since the latest call in a and pushes this to the undo stack.

member.summary: Cancels the active transaction: Any s executed since the latest call are un-executed
